Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product sold on the Aptly Dressed e-commerce platform.

imageUrl.description: URL of the product's main image.

category.description: Category the product belongs to (e.g., dress, shirt, shoes).

styleRecommendationIds.description: References to StyleRecommendations. (Relationship: StyleRecommendation N:N Product)

UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile on the Aptly Dressed e-commerce platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

shippingAddresses.description: Shipping addresses associated with the user.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a user on the Aptly Dressed e-commerce platform.

orderDate.description: Date when the order was placed.

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an item within an order on the Aptly Dressed e-commerce platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product in the order item.

StyleRecommendation.title: StyleRecommendation
StyleRecommendation.description: Represents a style recommendation generated for a user based on AI analysis.

id.description: Unique identifier for the style recommendation.

description.description: Description of the style recommendation, generated by AI.

reasoning.description: Reasoning behind the style recommendation, as determined by AI.

productIds.description: References to Products. (Relationship: StyleRecommendation N:N Product)

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support the Aptly Dressed e-commerce platform, focusing on user profiles, products, orders, style recommendations, and order items. The structure emphasizes clear relationships and authorization independence.  User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}` enabling path-based ownership, simplifying security rules. Orders are stored as subcollections of users (`/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`), further reinforcing ownership and allowing for easy retrieval of a user's order history. Order items are located as subcollections within each order (`/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}/order_items/{orderItemId}`), thus creating a natural hierarchy.  Products and StyleRecommendations exist in their own top-level collections (`/products/{productId}` and `/style_recommendations/{styleRecommendationId}`), respectively. This design ensures that rules do not require `get()` calls to parent documents for authorization, preventing broken atomic operations (transactions/batches). Authorization Independence is achieved via path-based ownership for user-related data. The QAPs are supported by segregating the data based on ownership and access patterns, allowing secure list operations within the user's scope.
